intro: Descurainia richardsonii var. macrosperma, commonly known as the broad-seeded tansy mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, oblanceolate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a slender, elongated pod containing several seeds. This species is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
